dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga b Mustafizur Rahman 56 (99b 5x4 0x6) SR: 56.56

dismissalComment.html: gone next ball. Completely messes up the timing on his pull. He rolls his fingers over a shortish one and as a result the ball doesn't get up as much as Tharanga anticipated as well. Shoots past from underneath the bat and cuts in to hit the stumps. 50th ODI wicket for Mustafizur

dismissalText.long: c Tamim Iqbal b Mehidy Hasan Miraz
dismissalText.commentary: Danushka Gunathilaka c Tamim Iqbal b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 6 (11b 1x4 0x6) SR: 54.54

dismissalComment.html: and Bangladesh have their first breakthrough. And it arrives via a gift. Poor, poor shot early in the innings from Gunathilaka. Clears the front leg and tries to loft this fuller ball straight over. But it's a bit too full and he can't get underneath that entirely. Knocks it high into the air and long-off runs to his left to snaffle it

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 28 (9b 2x4 3x6) SR: 311.11

dismissalComment.html: oh, dear! Kusal Mendis has thrown it away. He looked in a hurry throughout and he's just played a shot he'll be cross with himself for. Tries to force a pull to the wrong line and length and chips it in the air right off the bottom of the bat to give mid-on some catching practice. Mashrafe is pretty pumped up after that scalp. Doesn't hold back from expressing himself

dismissalText.commentary: Suranga Lakmal run out (Mushfiqur Rahim) 2 (4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: fullish, curving in, stays away from it and swipes big. Misses and they take off for a bye. The run was always non-existent but this is the last ball of the innings and they make the dash. Anyway, it results in a run out at the striker's end by Rahim and Sri Lanka are all out

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Tharanga b Madushanka 76 (92b 6x4 3x6) SR: 82.6

dismissalComment.html: in the aiiir and taken! A hat-trick for Madhushanka on international debut. And that seals it for Sri Lanka. And it's the priced wicket of Mahmudullah. A perfect finish to a perfect debut. This one's at a short of good length. Mahmudullah backs himself to clear the in-field with this slap but chips it off the splice to extra cover

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Tharanga b Dananjaya 22 (40b 1x4 0x6) SR: 55

dismissalComment.html: now the conventional sweep. He was getting just a little itchy and he has swept to the wrong length. A legbreak that bounces a little more and takes the top edge before settling into the hands of short fine leg

that's another dismissal to a poor shot. They might just check for the no ball. Has the bowler overstepped? There just might be a small, small portion of the foot behind the line. Benefit of the doubt might go to the bowler. And yes, given. First international wicket for Madushanka. A full toss that's been swatted straight into the hands of midwicket

he's on a hat-trick on debut. What a memorable one he's having! His team is cruising to a big win and he's hastening their push. An extremely full delivery, the perfect one to the tailender. Rubel swings without getting underneath or behind it and the ball curves in to clatter the stumps

oh, dear. Bangladesh are losing it here but what's worse is they're all getting out to atrocious shots. This is a short ball that really doesn't deserve a wicket. But of all the vast spaces at the Shere Bangla, he swivels into a pull that lands straight into the waiting hands of midwicket

dismissalComment.html: oh, a run out. Bangladesh really didn't need this. A direct hit catches him well short of the crease. And it's Thisara Perera, Sri Lanka's golden boy this series. A length ball that's knocked to mid-off. He decides to take on the fielder there and as it turns out, it'll be the last thing he does this innings. Perera charges in, swoops down and has one stump to aim at

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Saifuddin run out (Gunaratne) 8 (29b 0x4 0x6) SR: 27.58

dismissalComment.html: is that a run out? And more importantly is Gunaratne alright? Saifuddin nudges this one to midwicket and there is total chaos on the single. In the end, Saifuddin sacrifices his wicket but Gunaratne had only one stump to aim at so he charges forward with ball in hand,dives forward and shatters the stumps, hits into the fielder backing up, and then the knee of the batsman, running in at full tilt, strikes the side of his head. But he's alright

commentTextItems.html: in the aiiir and taken! A hat-trick for Madhushanka on international debut. And that seals it for Sri Lanka. And it's the priced wicket of Mahmudullah. A perfect finish to a perfect debut. This one's at a short of good length. Mahmudullah backs himself to clear the in-field with this slap but chips it off the splice to extra cover

commentPostTextItems.html: Sri Lanka's players run in towards the trophy with glee written all over their faces. Boy must this victory taste sweet, after all they've been through over the last couple of years, especially 2017, which was an absolutely disastrous year for them. It looked like they would continue down that road when they kicked off this series with a brace of defeats. But how things can turn around in a couple of weeks. Sri Lanka looked like the least likely side to make the final and now here they stand champions. That wraps up our coverage of this game. But the world of cricket isn't going to sleep anytime soon. The India-South Africa Test is shaping up to be an exciting back-and-forth contest. And of course, we will have a ton of content streaming in post the opening day of the IPL auction. So suit yourselves and tuck in. From here, it's goodbye! Thanks for your company and comments!

"I think the bowling has been pretty good", says Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza. "We needed to take our chances chasing 220 but we bowled well. We unfortunately lost Shakin but that shouldn't be an excuse for this defeat. Mahmudullah batted very well. We thought 220-230 would have been perfect. We could have been a little better with the bowling perhaps, but we couldn't get any partnership going with the bat. Mahmudullah batted well but unfortunately it didn't prove good enough for the team. The fans have always been with us and supported us no matter what. Hopefully they will continue to support us.I wish the Test team all the very best."

Upul Tharanga is Man of the Match. "It was very difficult to score", he says. "According to the wicket and according to the plan, we batted really well. It was very difficult for even the best of batsmen to score. But Dickwella batted very well and gave us momentum. We knew we got a decent score and the first 10 overs would be crucial. Dushmantha bowled very well and the lines and lengths were very good."

Thisara Perera is Man of the Series for his brilliant performances with bat and ball. What a series he's had! "We came back strongly in the series, which is the team spirit Sri Lanka have," he says. "Kusal Mendis in form the last two games is a good sign for Sri Lankan cricket. Credit goes to batsmen and bowlers. I have worked with the bowling coach and it's worked for me."

"We are over the moon as a team", says Sri Lanka captain Dinesh Chandimal. "This is the hard work of everyone. After losing the first two games, the guys put their heart and soul in practice sessions and finally here we are, winners. We all know Bangladesh especially on home soil are playing very good cricket over the last two years. So we never underestimate the Bangladesh team. We needed one or two wickets, that's what I told the guys, and Akila Dhananjaya gave us those wickets. Upul and Niroshan and myself and Upul put up good partnerships. Madushanka is outtsanding. We all know he can bowl fast and that's why he came here. He's grabbed his chance. We're very happy he bowled well and this is a memorable moment for him. Angelo Mathews is the one who got us here and credit goes to him."
Mazahir: "You are on debut, only three wickets remaining and you are not in the wickets column. Suddenly you have some sort of record and hat-trick under your name. Congrats to Madushanka and SL. "

7.36pm Madushanka raises his arms triumphantly and his team-mates jump around him even as his face is lit up by a 100-watt smile. He's had a dream debut. He was thrown to the dogs in the final and he has more than held his own. The wickets may have come once the game was over, but mind you he bowled a pretty accurate first spell where he gave away little.

Don't forget the contributions of Dushmantha Chameera, Akila Dananjaya, and among the batsmen, Upul Tharanga, Kusal Mendis, Niroshan Dickwella and Dinesh Chandimal, who all chipped in with vital scores.
Bangladesh unfortunately lost Shakib Al Hasan to injury, but even without him, this was a shoddy and listless batting performance.

"It was a great occasion to prove ourselves and a great series win," says Danushka Gunathilaka. "We thought 220 would be a good score on this wicket which we managed to get. We knew our bowling attack is good. The ball didn't come on properly. Their fast bowlers and ours produced a lot of variations. Madushanka was surprised when the team was announced and a dream start to his international career. We train hard back home, so we really needed to win a series. We didn't do well in the last 6-7 months, so we badly needed to win the series."

dismissalText.commentary: Danushka Gunathilaka c Tamim Iqbal b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 6 (11b 1x4 0x6) SR: 54.54

dismissalComment.html: and Bangladesh have their first breakthrough. And it arrives via a gift. Poor, poor shot early in the innings from Gunathilaka. Clears the front leg and tries to loft this fuller ball straight over. But it's a bit too full and he can't get underneath that entirely. Knocks it high into the air and long-off runs to his left to snaffle it

headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga b Mustafizur Rahman 56 (99b 5x4 0x6) SR: 56.56

dismissalComment.html: gone next ball. Completely messes up the timing on his pull. He rolls his fingers over a shortish one and as a result the ball doesn't get up as much as Tharanga anticipated as well. Shoots past from underneath the bat and cuts in to hit the stumps. 50th ODI wicket for Mustafizur

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 28 (9b 2x4 3x6) SR: 311.11

dismissalComment.html: oh, dear! Kusal Mendis has thrown it away. He looked in a hurry throughout and he's just played a shot he'll be cross with himself for. Tries to force a pull to the wrong line and length and chips it in the air right off the bottom of the bat to give mid-on some catching practice. Mashrafe is pretty pumped up after that scalp. Doesn't hold back from expressing himself

dismissalComment.html: ah, what has Dickwella done here? Gets a shortish delivery that pitches on leg stump and gets slightly big on him. dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal b Rubel Hossain 45 (74b 0x4 1x6) SR: 60.81

dismissalComment.html: a perfect, searing yorker. Angled on middle and right on the money. Chandimal gets the front leg out, does not maintain any good position and swings across the line as the ball clatters into the stumps

dismissalText.long: c Tamim Iqbal b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c Tamim Iqbal b Rubel Hossain 2 (10b 0x4 0x6) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: short ball, Thisara shapes up to pull but the ball jags away after pitching and as a result Thisara is forced to fetch it and skews it in the air off the bottom of the bat. Midwicket settles under it

dismissalText.commentary: Asela Gunaratne lbw b Rubel Hossain 6 (14b 0x4 0x6) SR: 42.85

dismissalComment.html: full, angling in and hits the pad. Seems momentarily as if there's an inside edge. The umpire raises his finger and Gunaratne reviews it. Swings in the air and comes in further off the deck to gets past the attempt at a flick. So no inside edge. And it's clipping leg stump

dismissalText.commentary: Akila Dananjaya c Mohammad Mithun b Mustafizur Rahman 17 (16b 1x4 1x6) SR: 106.25

dismissalComment.html: proper catch practice to cover. Can't possibly get out in a tamer fashion. Simply backs away to a short of a length delivery and chips it straight and gently into the hands of Mithun

dismissalText.commentary: Shehan Madushanka b Rubel Hossain 7 (6b 1x4 0x6) SR: 116.66

dismissalComment.html: another scorching yorker. Very similar to the one that cleaned up Chandimal. Madushanka can't get anywhere underneath that and swings and misses as the ball clatters into middle and off

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Mithun run out (Perera) 10 (27b 0x4 1x6) SR: 37.03

dismissalComment.html: oh, a run out. Bangladesh really didn't need this. A direct hit catches him well short of the crease. And it's Thisara Perera, Sri Lanka's golden boy this series. A length ball that's knocked to mid-off. He decides to take on the fielder there and as it turns out, it'll be the last thing he does this innings. Perera charges in, swoops down and has one stump to aim at

headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c Gunaratne b Chameera 2 (9b 0x4 0x6) SR: 22.22

dismissalComment.html: oh, dear. Bangladesh are losing it here but what's worse is they're all getting out to atrocious shots. This is a short ball that really doesn't deserve a wicket. But of all the vast spaces at the Shere Bangla, he swivels into a pull that lands straight into the waiting hands of midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Tharanga b Dananjaya 22 (40b 1x4 0x6) SR: 55

dismissalComment.html: now the conventional sweep. He was getting just a little itchy and he has swept to the wrong length. A legbreak that bounces a little more and takes the top edge before settling into the hands of short fine leg

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Tharanga b Madushanka 76 (92b 6x4 3x6) SR: 82.6

dismissalComment.html: in the aiiir and taken! A hat-trick for Madhushanka on international debut. And that seals it for Sri Lanka. And it's the priced wicket of Mahmudullah. A perfect finish to a perfect debut. This one's at a short of good length. Mahmudullah backs himself to clear the in-field with this slap but chips it off the splice to extra cover

dismissalComment.html: chipped straight back. Sri Lanka owe Bangladesh a free catching practice session. Pitched right up, closes the face looking for a flick but checks his stroke and chips it straight back to the bowler. Half the side gone but effectively six down

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Saifuddin run out (Gunaratne) 8 (29b 0x4 0x6) SR: 27.58

dismissalComment.html: is that a run out? And more importantly is Gunaratne alright? Saifuddin nudges this one to midwicket and there is total chaos on the single. In the end, Saifuddin sacrifices his wicket but Gunaratne had only one stump to aim at so he charges forward with ball in hand,dives forward and shatters the stumps, hits into the fielder backing up, and then the knee of the batsman, running in at full tilt, strikes the side of his head. But he's alright

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c Mendis b Madushanka 5 (12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 41.66

dismissalComment.html: that's another dismissal to a poor shot. They might just check for the no ball. Has the bowler overstepped? There just might be a small, small portion of the foot behind the line. Benefit of the doubt might go to the bowler. And yes, given. First international wicket for Madushanka. A full toss that's been swatted straight into the hands of midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain b Madushanka 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: he's on a hat-trick on debut. What a memorable one he's having! His team is cruising to a big win and he's hastening their push. An extremely full delivery, the perfect one to the tailender. Rubel swings without getting underneath or behind it and the ball curves in to clatter the stumps

dismissalComment.html: and Tamim looks a gift horse in the mouth. Gives his wicket away next ball. Shortish with zero room. Tamim tries to force a pull. The runs weren't coming and he was desperate. Manages a healthy top-edge that is taken at midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Mithun player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Mithun player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Mithun player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Mithun player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Mithun run out (Perera) 10 (27b 0x4 1x6) SR: 37.03

dismissalComment.html: oh, a run out. Bangladesh really didn't need this. A direct hit catches him well short of the crease. And it's Thisara Perera, Sri Lanka's golden boy this series. A length ball that's knocked to mid-off. He decides to take on the fielder there and as it turns out, it'll be the last thing he does this innings. Perera charges in, swoops down and has one stump to aim at

headshotImage.caption: Dushmantha Chameera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dushmantha Chameera player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c Gunaratne b Chameera 2 (9b 0x4 0x6) SR: 22.22

dismissalComment.html: oh, dear. Bangladesh are losing it here but what's worse is they're all getting out to atrocious shots. This is a short ball that really doesn't deserve a wicket. But of all the vast spaces at the Shere Bangla, he swivels into a pull that lands straight into the waiting hands of midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Tharanga b Dananjaya 22 (40b 1x4 0x6) SR: 55

dismissalComment.html: now the conventional sweep. He was getting just a little itchy and he has swept to the wrong length. A legbreak that bounces a little more and takes the top edge before settling into the hands of short fine leg

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mehidy Hasan Miraz c & b Dananjaya 5 (14b 0x4 0x6) SR: 35.71

dismissalComment.html: chipped straight back. Sri Lanka owe Bangladesh a free catching practice session. Pitched right up, closes the face looking for a flick but checks his stroke and chips it straight back to the bowler. Half the side gone but effectively six down

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Saifuddin  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Saifuddin  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Saifuddin  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Saifuddin  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Saifuddin run out (Gunaratne) 8 (29b 0x4 0x6) SR: 27.58

dismissalComment.html: is that a run out? And more importantly is Gunaratne alright? Saifuddin nudges this one to midwicket and there is total chaos on the single. In the end, Saifuddin sacrifices his wicket but Gunaratne had only one stump to aim at so he charges forward with ball in hand,dives forward and shatters the stumps, hits into the fielder backing up, and then the knee of the batsman, running in at full tilt, strikes the side of his head. But he's alright

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c Mendis b Madushanka 5 (12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 41.66

dismissalComment.html: that's another dismissal to a poor shot. They might just check for the no ball. Has the bowler overstepped? There just might be a small, small portion of the foot behind the line. Benefit of the doubt might go to the bowler. And yes, given. First international wicket for Madushanka. A full toss that's been swatted straight into the hands of midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain b Madushanka 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: he's on a hat-trick on debut. What a memorable one he's having! His team is cruising to a big win and he's hastening their push. An extremely full delivery, the perfect one to the tailender. Rubel swings without getting underneath or behind it and the ball curves in to clatter the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Tharanga b Madushanka 76 (92b 6x4 3x6) SR: 82.6

dismissalComment.html: in the aiiir and taken! A hat-trick for Madhushanka on international debut. And that seals it for Sri Lanka. And it's the priced wicket of Mahmudullah. A perfect finish to a perfect debut. This one's at a short of good length. Mahmudullah backs himself to clear the in-field with this slap but chips it off the splice to extra cover
